reviews.review: ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ·Ğ¾Ñ€,Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‡Ñƒ ÑĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ°ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°!

Short, but so, so sweet. The plot has a whole series of twists and turns that will keep you going, "What the f---..." right up until the VERY end. My only regret is that I beat it so quickly, because now all I want is more.

I enjoyed the extremely trippy story. The action and rpg elements of this game were well done. My biggest issue was a weird and frequent framerate stutter no matter what graphics settings I had it at. On ultra  I was able to run at 120-170fps with my current set up. Even at that FPS there was tons of stuttering. My rig is an i7-7820HK, 1070 GTX, 16 GB Ram on an SSD with a 120Hz 1440 G-Sync monitor. Don't know whats going on but a lot of people seem to experience similar stuttering. Luckily the game was good enough to ignore it.

8/10

O game Ã© lindo, de encher os olhos, soube lidar com o desafio de nÃ£o estragar uma sÃ©rie maravilhosa e fechar uma trilogia, e conseguiu perfeitamente. Desde o primeiro Bioshock, os graficos ja eram estonteantes, de modo que vocÃª parava o jogo apenas para admirar a Ã¡gua, e o que aconteceu com o infinite, nÃ£o foi diferente, quando vocÃª chega em Columbia e ve a arte da cidade, vocÃª fica maravilhado, por uns 5 minutos esqueci do jogo, e fiquei paseando pela cidade. A historia te prende e o jogo esta bem mais dinamico que os antecessores, e a transiÃ§Ã£o do mar para o ar, nÃ£o fez perder a identidade do jogo, com seus elementos steampunk. O jogo superou minhas espectativas com louvor.

Increible, llevo bastante iempo buscando un juego que me atrape y que me duela cuando terminara; este sabado lo encontrÃ©. En tres dÃ­as le dedique mas de 13 horas y reciÃ©n lo terminÃ©. La forma de describirlo es: Increible. Cada segundo que pasa te adentras mas y mas en un mundo desconocido y te dan mas ganas de descubrir cada secreto que oculta. Primer juego donde me da gusto obtener los coleccionables. 
Recomendado al 100%

One of the best games i've ever played

Absolutely one of the best games I have ever bought. The graphics are amazing, story is also amazing andf just everything about this game is very good. If you got the money to get this game, do it its worth every cent.

Its a pretty game with suffocating gameplay. you lose money with each death so you never get better, sky hooks aren't as satisfying as you think, gears are mostly a cheap gimmick that never merits any thought as to what is good,you only get to hold 2 weapons so you have to abandon stuff you love for crappier weapons solely due to lower ammo being in the area and hard mode highlights these flaws to an obnoxious extent. just get bioshock 2 and pretend this game does't exist.

havent beat it but i just bought it and it is still completely worth it in 2017
Fantastic game, 8 hours from start to finish. A great buy if it's on sale. You do not need to have played Bioshock 1+2 to play Infinite.
Epic, great story, great action and superb graphics. Very enjoyable 12 hours. Not usually a fan of linear games, but it made sense.

Great game! Bioshock had fidget spinners before they were a thing.
I learned how to catch things.
i finished the games in 11 hours. no doubt one of the best games i played. i strongly recommend this game.

Story 10/10 ( words can not describe it)
Game play 7/10
But you will not care about the gameplay in the end i promise. 
TRY IT :)
P.S : for the best experience play Bioshock 1 first.

oh my god... i have never teared up at a game before until i played a game as beutifle as this. its amazing story blew my mind and would 100% reccomed this. if u have a spare few $$$ and a few hours buy it

Well this game is definitely one of the best story game I've played. The graphic is nice and the developers did a great job of making Columbia looks beautiful and gorgeous. Sometimes I just get distracted and stare at the sceneries instead. The combat is smooth and I can walk around and explore the map since there are collectibles around the places. So, stop hesitate and just buy it.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
